description: Comprehensive 3D printing tips and tricks for Klipper-based FDM printers with OrcaSlicer

klipper_features.name: Klipper-Specific Features
klipper_features.description: Advanced Klipper firmware capabilities for improved printing

tips.title: Run Input Shaping Calibration
tips.content: Use Klipper's resonance testing (TEST_RESONANCES) with an accelerometer to eliminate ringing/ghosting at high speeds

tips.title: Enable Pressure Advance
tips.content: Calibrate with TUNING_TOWER macro to eliminate bulging corners and gaps on direction changes (typical range: 0.02-0.08 for direct drive, 0.3-0.9 for Bowden)

tips.title: Use Adaptive Bed Meshing
tips.content: Enable adaptive_bed_mesh in Klipper to only mesh the print area, saving time on small prints

tips.title: Leverage Firmware Retraction
tips.content: Configure [firmware_retraction] in Klipper for consistent results across slicers and easy tuning without re-slicing

tips.title: Enable Square Corner Velocity
tips.content: Set square_corner_velocity in [printer] section (5-8mm/s typical) to maintain speed through corners without sacrificing quality

tips.title: Use PRINT_START Macros
tips.content: Create comprehensive PRINT_START macros that handle homing, QGL/ABL, heating, purging, and adaptive meshing

tips.title: Monitor with Exclude Object
tips.content: Enable [exclude_object] in Klipper to cancel individual failed parts in multi-object prints via Mainsail/Fluidd

tips.title: Tune Max Accel Per Feature
tips.content: Set different max_accel values for perimeters vs infill in OrcaSlicer to optimize speed/quality balance

tips.title: Use Velocity Limits
tips.content: Set realistic max_velocity and max_accel in Klipper based on input shaping results, not just what your printer can mechanically handle

tips.title: Enable Stepper Timeout
tips.content: Configure idle_timeout to disable steppers after prints but keep heaters active for easy part removal

orcaslicer_features.name: OrcaSlicer Calibration & Features
orcaslicer_features.description: OrcaSlicer-specific tools and settings for optimal slicing

tips.title: Run Flow Rate Calibration
tips.content: Use OrcaSlicer's built-in flow calibration test (pass 1 & 2) to get perfect extrusion multiplier per filament

tips.title: Calibrate Temperature Towers
tips.content: Use OrcaSlicer's temperature tower generator to find optimal temps for each filament brand/color

tips.title: Use Filament Profiles
tips.content: Create detailed filament profiles with calibrated temps, flow rates, and retraction settings for each spool

tips.title: Enable Arachne Perimeter Generator
tips.content: Switch to Arachne engine for variable-width perimeters that improve strength and surface quality

tips.title: Use Adaptive Layer Heights
tips.content: Enable adaptive layer height with smooth transitions for curved surfaces while keeping flat areas fast

tips.title: Leverage Arc Fitting
tips.content: Enable 'Arc fitting' to convert small segments into G2/G3 arc commands, reducing file size and improving curved surface quality

tips.title: Use Auto-Arranged Printing
tips.content: For multiple objects, use 'Print by Object' mode (requires sufficient Z-clearance) to prevent total print failure

tips.title: Enable Ironing
tips.content: Use top surface ironing sparingly (only on visible flat tops) for glass-smooth finishes at the cost of time

tips.title: Tune Retraction with Calibration
tips.content: Use OrcaSlicer's retraction tower test to dial in perfect retraction distance and speed

tips.title: Use Seam Position Control
tips.content: Set seam to 'rear' or 'hide' mode to minimize visible seam marks on curved prints

speed_quality.name: Speed vs Quality Optimization
speed_quality.description: Techniques to balance printing speed with output quality

tips.title: Separate Outer/Inner Perimeter Speeds
tips.content: Run outer perimeters 40-60% slower than inner for better surface finish without killing total print time

tips.title: Use Layer Time Minimums
tips.content: Set minimum layer time (10-15s) to prevent insufficient cooling on small layers

tips.title: Enable Dynamic Acceleration
tips.content: Use lower acceleration for outer perimeters (1000-2000mm/s^2) and higher for infill (3000-5000mm/s^2)

tips.title: Optimize Infill Percentage
tips.content: Use 10-15% gyroid infill for most functional parts (strong, fast, minimal material)

tips.title: Use Draft Shield Sparingly
tips.content: Only enable for heat-sensitive materials (ABS/ASA) to prevent warping, not for PLA

tips.title: Tune Travel Speed High
tips.content: Set travel moves to 250-350mm/s (Klipper can handle it) to reduce non-print time

tips.title: Use Thick Top/Bottom Layers
tips.content: 4-6 top layers + ironing creates better finish than slow speeds with thin layers

tips.title: Enable Support Interface Layers
tips.content: Add 2-3 interface layers between supports and part for easier removal and cleaner surfaces

tips.title: Adjust Line Width for Strength
tips.content: Use 120-150% nozzle diameter line width for stronger parts (0.48-0.6mm for 0.4mm nozzle)

tips.title: Use Sequential Printing for Speed
tips.content: Print multiple small objects in sequence (if Z-clearance allows) to reduce travel and oozing

print_quality.name: Print Quality Improvements
print_quality.description: Tips focused specifically on improving final print quality

tips.title: Dry Your Filament
tips.content: Even 'new' filament absorbs moisture; dry PLA at 50C for 4-6 hours, PETG at 65C for 6-8 hours

tips.title: Tune Z-Offset Precisely
tips.content: Use Klipper's PROBE_CALIBRATE or paper test; perfect first layer is 80% of print success

tips.title: Use Textured Build Plates
tips.content: PEI sheets provide better adhesion and eliminate need for glue/tape for most materials

tips.title: Clean Build Surface Properly
tips.content: Use IPA for PLA/PETG, soap and water for PEI to remove oils and residue

tips.title: Enable Monotonic Top Fill
tips.content: Use monotonic infill pattern for top surfaces to eliminate pillowing and create consistent sheen

tips.title: Reduce Outer Perimeter Count
tips.content: 2-3 perimeters sufficient for most prints; more adds time without much strength benefit

tips.title: Use Fuzzy Skin Wisely
tips.content: Apply fuzzy skin texture to hide layer lines on organic/artistic prints

tips.title: Calibrate Extrusion Multiplier Per Material
tips.content: Each filament brand/type needs its own flow calibration (typically 0.92-1.05 range)

tips.title: Enable Detect Thin Walls
tips.content: Ensure OrcaSlicer detects and prints thin features that might be skipped

tips.title: Use Variable Layer Heights
tips.content: Set 0.1mm for detailed areas, 0.3mm for structural areas in same print

troubleshooting.name: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: Common issues and how to diagnose/fix them

tips.title: Check Belt Tension
tips.content: Properly tensioned belts (110Hz +/- 10Hz with phone app) prevent layer shifting and improve quality

tips.title: Verify E-Steps Calibration
tips.content: Calibrate extruder steps/mm by extruding 100mm and measuring actual output

tips.title: Monitor Part Cooling
tips.content: Use at least 50% cooling for PLA overhangs, less for PETG/ABS; run cooling fan tests

tips.title: Check for Partial Clogs
tips.content: If under-extruding despite calibration, cold pull with nylon or cleaning filament

tips.title: Verify Frame Rigidity
tips.content: Loose frame members cause resonance; check all bolts/extrusions for tightness

tips.title: Use Klipper's Graph Tool
tips.content: Analyze resonance graphs to identify mechanical issues (loose belts, worn bearings)

tips.title: Monitor Filament Path
tips.content: Ensure smooth filament feeding; add PTFE tubing or guides to prevent binding

tips.title: Check Nozzle Wear
tips.content: Brass nozzles wear quickly with abrasive filaments; upgrade to hardened steel if needed

tips.title: Verify Thermistor Accuracy
tips.content: Compare Klipper-reported temps with infrared thermometer to catch thermistor drift

tips.title: Review G-code with Previewer
tips.content: Always preview in OrcaSlicer before printing to catch slicing errors, bad supports, or thin walls
